definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to burst open/to split at the seam
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: His remark is full of contradictions and flaws.
sentences.chinese: 他的话前后矛盾，破绽百出。

sentences.english: The witness tripped up rather badly under close cross-examination.
sentences.chinese: 这个证人在严密的交叉盘问之下破绽百出。

definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
split seam/(fig.) flaw/weak point
(following a noun) full of .../abounding in ...
clumsy/botched
to be in straitened circumstances
hard to tell if it's real or sham
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
lit. seamless heavenly clothes (idiom)/fig. flawless
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
lit. not one drop of water can leak out/watertight/rigorous (argument)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
error and negligence
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
